Entry.JapaneseText: [VARIABLE]
Entry.EnglishText: [VARIABLE]

Entry.JapaneseText: 駅員
Entry.EnglishText: Station Attendant

Entry.JapaneseText: select
Entry.EnglishText: Select

Entry.JapaneseText: 女の子
Entry.EnglishText: Girl

Entry.JapaneseText: 女の人
Entry.EnglishText: Woman

Entry.JapaneseText: カレギア兵
Entry.EnglishText: Callegean Soldier

Entry.JapaneseText: <Claire>
Entry.EnglishText: <Claire>

Entry.JapaneseText: <Tytree>
Entry.EnglishText: <Tytree>

Entry.JapaneseText: <Veigue>
Entry.EnglishText: <Veigue>

Entry.JapaneseText: <Mao>
Entry.EnglishText: <Mao>

Entry.JapaneseText: <Eugene>
Entry.EnglishText: <Eugene>

Entry.JapaneseText: <Annie>
Entry.EnglishText: <Annie>

Entry.JapaneseText: <Hilda>
Entry.EnglishText: <Hilda>

Entry.JapaneseText: 首都バルカ
Entry.EnglishText: Capital City Balka

Entry.JapaneseText: 首都バルカ
Entry.EnglishText: Capital City Balka

Entry.JapaneseText: 道具屋
Entry.EnglishText: Item Shop

Entry.JapaneseText: 道具屋
Entry.EnglishText: Item Shop

Entry.JapaneseText: <font:80000002>バルカ鉄道は、無料で ご利用いただけます。 ご乗車になりますか？
Entry.EnglishText: <font:80000002>The Balka Railway is free of charge. Would you like to take a ride?

Entry.JapaneseText: 南門広場
Entry.EnglishText: South Gate

Entry.JapaneseText: 西門前
Entry.EnglishText: West Gate

Entry.JapaneseText: カレギア城前
Entry.EnglishText: Callegea Castle

Entry.JapaneseText: 商店前
Entry.EnglishText: General Store

Entry.JapaneseText: 鉄道に乗らない
Entry.EnglishText: Don't Ride

Entry.JapaneseText: わたち、ヨッツアの事 ちってる！
Entry.EnglishText: I know Yotza!

Entry.JapaneseText: いっつもヘンテコな話ばっかり ちてくれるんだよ！
Entry.EnglishText: He is always telling us the strangest stories!

Entry.JapaneseText: わたち、儀式に女王様に お花を捧げる役目になったの。
Entry.EnglishText: I have been given the honor of offering flowers during Her Majesty's ceremony.

Entry.JapaneseText: 今からキンチョーしてるの…… ソソウちたらどうちよう……
Entry.EnglishText: I have butterflies in my stomach... What if me mess it up...

Entry.JapaneseText: あくとーが女王様の命をねらって お城に入り込んだんだって……！
Entry.EnglishText: Apparently some evil doer entered the castle in an attempt to take Her Majesty's life...

Entry.JapaneseText: あなたたちは……
Entry.EnglishText: You people...

Entry.JapaneseText: あくとーには…… 見えないわね……
Entry.EnglishText: You didn't happen to see anything...

Entry.JapaneseText: わたち、ガジュマはキライ…… よくわかんないけど、イヤ！
Entry.EnglishText: I hate Gajuma... I don't know why, but I hate them!

Entry.JapaneseText: わたちが儀式で活躍する ケッテー的シュンカンを みんなに見てもらうはず だったのに……
Entry.EnglishText: I was hoping everyone would get to see me during my big moment of the inauguration ceremony...
Entry.Notes: I don't know how best to translate this and the following line.

Entry.JapaneseText: 儀式がチューシになって、 残念……
Entry.EnglishText: But they are only letting a select few people in. Too bad...
Entry.Notes: I don't know how best to translate this and the previous line.

Entry.JapaneseText: わたち、なんかね、このごろ ガジュマのおともだちと 遊ぶのがイヤなの……
Entry.EnglishText: Recently I haven't liked to play with any of my Gajuma friends...

Entry.JapaneseText: ケンカもちてないのに どうちてかなぁ……
Entry.EnglishText: I'm not currently fighting with any of them, so I don't know what happened...

Entry.JapaneseText: わたち、ガジュマはキライ…… よくわかんないけど、イヤ！
Entry.EnglishText: I hate Gajuma... I don't know why, but I hate them!

Entry.JapaneseText: おとうちゃんが言ってたよ！ ガジュマはヒューマを いじめるって！
Entry.EnglishText: Gajuma are bullies to the Huma. Papa told me so!

Entry.JapaneseText: だから、わたち、 ガジュマなんかと 仲良くちないもん！
Entry.EnglishText: That is why we cannot be friends with any Gajuma.

Entry.JapaneseText: 女王様やジルバ様は、 ヒューマをキライなんだって おとうちゃんが言ってたよ！
Entry.EnglishText: Papa told me that Lord Zilva and Her Majesty hate the Huma.

Entry.JapaneseText: だから、何かあるとすぐに へーたいさんが、ヒューマを 捕まえるんだって！
Entry.EnglishText: He said that the guard will round up any Huma should anything happen.

Entry.JapaneseText: おとうちゃんがね、 ガジュマの悪口を言うと ほめてくれるんだよ！
Entry.EnglishText: Papa is so proud of me when I say bad things about the Gajuma.

Entry.JapaneseText: だから、わたちいつも ガジュマの悪口を言ってるの！
Entry.EnglishText: That's why we're always bad mouthing the Gajuma.

Entry.JapaneseText: 街はずれの商店なら、 機関ちゃに乗らないと。
Entry.EnglishText: If you are wanting to visit the store on the outskirts of town, you will need to take the locomotive.

Entry.JapaneseText: この前ね、お星さまが いっぱい降って来たの！
Entry.EnglishText: I saw a lot of stars falling out of the sky the other day.

Entry.JapaneseText: そちたらね、ガジュマの事、 イヤじゃなくなったの……
Entry.EnglishText: After that, I didn't feel like hating the Gajuma anymore...

Entry.JapaneseText: でも、おとうちゃんは ずーっとガジュマがキライなの…… どうちてかな……？
Entry.EnglishText: But Papa has always hated the Gajuma...I wonder why...?

Entry.JapaneseText: この前ね、お星さまが いっぱい降って来たの！
Entry.EnglishText: I saw a lot of stars falling out of the sky the other day.

Entry.JapaneseText: そちたらね、ガジュマの事、 イヤじゃなくなったの……
Entry.EnglishText: After that, I didn't feel like hating the Gajuma anymore...

Entry.JapaneseText: でも、おとうちゃんは ずーっとガジュマがキライなの…… どうちてかな……？
Entry.EnglishText: But Papa has always hated the Gajuma...I wonder why...?

Entry.JapaneseText: ねえ、この音はいつ終わるの？ うるさいから、わたち、 お昼寝ができないの……
Entry.EnglishText: Hey, when is that loud noise going to stop? It is so loud, I can't take my afternoon nap...

Entry.JapaneseText: おとうちゃんが、ラジルダが ホーカイちたって…… ホーカイってなあに？
Entry.EnglishText: Papa said that Razilda had collapsed. Collapsed...what does that mean?

Entry.JapaneseText: ねえ、どうして大人のヒトたちは ケンカばっかりしてるの？
Entry.EnglishText: Why are grownups always fighting with one another?

Entry.JapaneseText: みんなでバイラスを やっつけないとダメだって、 わたち、思うんだけどなぁ……
Entry.EnglishText: We all have to work together to stop the Birsues, at least that's what I think...

Entry.JapaneseText: この街は日当たりが悪いけど、 ちゃんとお手入れしてれば、 草木もちゃんと育つのよ。
Entry.EnglishText: This city doesn't get a lot of sun, but if you carefully tend the plants and trees, they'll grown just fine.

Entry.JapaneseText: さっき、そこの駅から ちっちゃな男の子みたいな ガジュマが汽車に乗ってったわ。
Entry.EnglishText: Just now, a young looking Gajuma boarded the train from that station over there.

Entry.JapaneseText: 何をそんなに 慌ててたのかしらねえ……
Entry.EnglishText: He looked like his was in a hurry, I wonder why...

Entry.JapaneseText: あなたも女王陛下の お披露目の儀式を……？
Entry.EnglishText: You are attending the inauguration ceremony for Her Majesty...?

Entry.JapaneseText: ミーハーな人の多い事……
Entry.EnglishText: There have been quite a lot of royal junkies recently...

Entry.JapaneseText: あなたたちは…… 怪しくはないわね。
Entry.EnglishText: And you lot...don't look suspicious.

Entry.JapaneseText: いえね、怪しい人がいたら、 すぐに軍に通報するように 言われてるのよ。
Entry.EnglishText: Good, we were told to report any suspicious individuals to the guards immediately.

Entry.JapaneseText: 儀式で何かあったら大変だし、 軍もかなりピリピリしてるわ。
Entry.EnglishText: The guard are totally on edge since if anything bad where to happen at the ceremony, it would be a total disaster.
Entry.Notes: The sentence feels clunky but I don't know whow to fit it without splitting it into two sentences.

Entry.JapaneseText: 不快！ 不快だわ……！
Entry.EnglishText: How unpleasant! How dreadful...!
Entry.Notes: 不快 means unpleasant, distatesful, discomfort, etc. I assume it flows into the next line (racist lady gotta be racist) so adjust/fix as you see fit for better flow.

Entry.JapaneseText: 近寄らないでくれる？ ガジュマのニオイがするだけで 気分が悪くなるの！
Entry.EnglishText: Stay away from me, won't you? The slightest air of Gajuma stench makes me want to retch!
Entry.Notes: Literal translation "stay away, will you? The smell of Gajuma makes me sick!"

Entry.JapaneseText: よくよく考えたら、 どうして、カレギアの王様は ガジュマなの？
Entry.EnglishText: I've thought about this for a while, but why is the monarch of our Callegea a Gajuma?

Entry.JapaneseText: そういう役目こそ、 ヒューマにふさわしい はずなのに……
Entry.EnglishText: For such a prestigious, important role a Huma would be farbetter suited...

Entry.JapaneseText: あんた、ガジュマなんかと 一緒にいると、ガジュマくさいのが うつっちゃうわよ！
Entry.EnglishText: If you keep company with Gajuma, they'll get their stench all over you!

Entry.JapaneseText: 不快！ 不快だわ……！
Entry.EnglishText: How unpleasant! How dreadful...!

Entry.JapaneseText: 近寄らないでくれる？ ガジュマのニオイがするだけで 気分が悪くなるの！
Entry.EnglishText: Stay away from me, won't you? The slightest air of Gajuma stench makes me want to retch!

Entry.JapaneseText: どうしてかしら…… ガジュマの事が憎くて たまらないの……！
Entry.EnglishText: I can't explain it...but I find Gajuma so intolerable...

Entry.JapaneseText: 心の中で、誰かが 「ガジュマを憎め、殺せ！」って 言ってるような気がするの……
Entry.EnglishText: I feel like there is this little voice inside my head whispering to me, "Hate the Gajuma! Kill the Gajuma!"

Entry.JapaneseText: ガジュマが何だって言うの！ ヒューマはガジュマなんかに 負けやしないわよ！
Entry.EnglishText: I have no concern about the Gajuma! They pose no threat to the Huma!

Entry.JapaneseText: ガジュマなんて…… ガジュマなんて滅べば いいのよ……！
Entry.EnglishText: All Gajuma... All Gajuma should be eradicated!

Entry.JapaneseText: あのジルバってお偉いさんが 何を言ったか知らないけどね、 ガジュマが調子に乗るんじゃないわよ！
Entry.EnglishText: I don't give a damn what this supposed big-shot Zilva had to say, but those Gajuma better not get too cocky!
Entry.Notes: 調子に乗る = to get caught up in the moment, get carried away, get cocky. Unlcear just how "angry" this woman is about this particular moment. Double check in context.

Entry.JapaneseText: どうしてかしら…… ガジュマの事が憎くて たまらないの……！
Entry.EnglishText: I can't explain it...but I find Gajuma so intolerable...

Entry.JapaneseText: 心の中で、誰かが 「ガジュマを憎め、殺せ！」って 言ってるような気がするの……
Entry.EnglishText: I feel like there is this little voice inside my head whispering to me, "Hate the Gajuma! Kill the Gajuma!"

Entry.JapaneseText: でも、なんだか怖い…… この気持ちが、本当に自分の ものなのかどうか、わからないの。
Entry.EnglishText: I'm a bit frightened... I don't know if these feelings are mine are truly mine.

Entry.JapaneseText: 病気の人？ それって…… 街の広場にいた……ガジュマ……
Entry.EnglishText: Someone is ill? In the center of town... A Gajuma...

Entry.JapaneseText: ……のわけ、ないわよね？
Entry.EnglishText: You aren't serious...are you?

Entry.JapaneseText: ……ガジュマとは 話したくないね。
Entry.EnglishText: ...I have nothing to say to a Gajuma.
Entry.Notes: Double check - unclear if it's to or about

Entry.JapaneseText: ついこの前まで、私はどうかしてたわ。 ガジュマを殺してやりたいなんて……
Entry.EnglishText: To think, I wanted to eradicate the Gajuma... I must have been truly out of my mind earlier.

Entry.JapaneseText: でも、そういう私に対する ガジュマの態度や言葉でわかったの…… 私たちはお互いに憎み合ってたんだって。
Entry.EnglishText: Yet the way the Gajuma spoke to me and the way they acted made me realize...we truly hated each other.

Entry.JapaneseText: ヒューマとガジュマの共存なんて うわべだけだったのよ……
Entry.EnglishText: The coexisteence between the Huma and the Gajuma was all for show...

Entry.JapaneseText: ……ガジュマとは 話したくないね。
Entry.EnglishText: ...I have nothing to say to a Gajuma.

Entry.JapaneseText: ついこの前まで、私はどうかしてたわ。 ガジュマを殺してやりたいなんて……
Entry.EnglishText: To think, I wanted to eradicate the Gajuma... I must have been truly out of my mind earlier.

Entry.JapaneseText: でも、そういう私に対する ガジュマの態度や言葉でわかったの…… 私たちはお互いに憎み合ってたんだって。
Entry.EnglishText: Yet the way the Gajuma spoke to me and the way they acted made me realize...we truly hated each other.

Entry.JapaneseText: ヒューマとガジュマの共存なんて うわべだけだったのよ……
Entry.EnglishText: The coexisteence between the Huma and the Gajuma was all for show...

Entry.JapaneseText: ……ガジュマとは 話したくないね。
Entry.EnglishText: ...I have nothing to say to a Gajuma.

Entry.JapaneseText: この地鳴り……どこから 聞こえて来るのかしら…… どうにも不気味ね……
Entry.EnglishText: These tremors...I wonder where they come from... They make me feel a bit uneasy...

Entry.JapaneseText: ラジルダが波に飲まれたそうよ。 あの街のガジュマって ヒューマ差別主義者ばかりよね。
Entry.EnglishText: They say Razilda was engulfed by the waves. That village was full of anti-Huma Gajuma.

Entry.JapaneseText: 少しは世の中もマシになるかも しれないわね……！
Entry.EnglishText: Perhaps the world is better off without the likes of them...

Entry.JapaneseText: ラジルダが波に飲まれたって…… あの街のヒューマが心配ね……
Entry.EnglishText: Razilda was wiped out by a tidal wave... I worry about the Huma who lived there...

Entry.JapaneseText: こんな時にガジュマが ヒューマのあたしに何の用!?
Entry.EnglishText: What could a Gajuma possible want from a Huma such as I!?

Entry.JapaneseText: ガジュマが先に逃げようとして ヒューマが何人もバイラスの犠牲に なったそうよ！
Entry.EnglishText: I heard the Gajuma attempted to flee, leaving the Huma to be massacred by the Birsues!

Entry.JapaneseText: あんたたちも早く逃げなさい！ ガジュマの犠牲にならないうちにね！
Entry.EnglishText: Get out of here, all of you! Hurry, before you become the latest victims of the Gajuma!

Entry.JapaneseText: この街は霧の日が多いから、 たまには日当たりのいいところで リゾート気分に浸りたいわね。
Entry.EnglishText: I long for a sunny resort spot to help burn away the gloom from living in such a foggy city.

Entry.JapaneseText: たとえば、ミナールとか サニイタウンとかね。
Entry.EnglishText: For example, Minal or Sunnytown.

Entry.JapaneseText: お披露目の儀式が無事に 終わるまでは、何事にも 油断はできんのだ。
Entry.EnglishText: Until the completion of the inauguration ceremony, we mustn't let our guard down.

Entry.JapaneseText: 我輩の目が黒いうちは どんな犯罪者も見逃さんのだ。
Entry.EnglishText: No criminal will be able to evade my unrelenting gaze of justice!
Entry.Notes: 我輩（わがはい） is an arrogant "me" or "I," and "目が黒いうち” is an expression that means "while I'm alive" or "as long as a I live." So, I decided to have a bit of fun with this arrogant soldier. If it doesn't work, you can use a more "grounded" translation. "As long as I am alive, no criminal shall escape judgement" or something.

Entry.JapaneseText: この警備の中、 何か悪さをしようとて、 どうにもなるまい。
Entry.EnglishText: With this level of security, it is impossible for anyone to committ any crimes.

Entry.JapaneseText: <speed:0><scale:140>休憩しますか？ はい いいえ
Entry.EnglishText: <speed:0><scale:140>Would you like to rest? Yes No

Entry.JapaneseText: 早く……薬を 届けてあげないと……
薬……誰か薬がどこにあるか、 知ってる人はいないかしら……
<speed:0>『サイユーキ』 お披露目の儀式記念上演！ <Yellow>ヒト<White>の心を持ったおしゃべりな パンチモンキーが、ブタのバイラス、 カワウソのバイラスとともに 西の果てを目指す大冒険活劇。 前売り券絶賛発売中！
おおっ、「サイユーキ」！ このお芝居、大好きなんだよなぁ！ ペトナジャンカ公演の時は、 毎日見たもんなぁ……
おしゃべりなパンチモンキー…… <Tytree>みたいだな……
へえ、このお芝居、 一年前もやってたけど、 人気なんだネ。
ボクは歌手のほうが やってみたいかも？
うむ……芝居も久しく 見てないな……
これに出演してる役者さん、 年齢よりも二十歳は若く見えるって 聞いたけど……いくつなのかしら。
……サーカスは やってないのかしら？
